title: (x) Typewriter on CD cover - real typewriter type {Stephen}
author: jack_with

comments.content: Here's another free [Typewriter font site](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051910/http:/www.free-typewriter-fonts.com/Fonts.html). this has about 70 choices. I can't say I had time to look for this one in the array, but it's worth a look.

Having built my fair share of typewriter faces and used this same technique for many a gig poster (hey, it was the 80�s... what can I say?), I can vouch for the fact that this is manually typewritten text. The uniqueness of the glyphs as Stephen pointed out (particularly the �e�) show the pattern of the ribbon texture changing with each strike.

\> US$ 2,500 worth of equipment   
   
:-)   
I don't think they had such equipment back then,   
in 1995, when they released [it](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051910/http:/www.allmusic.com/cg/amg.dll?p=amg&uid=UIDMISS70311110910171752&sql=Abq548qmnbtx4)...
